Prior¶

class pysip.core.prior.Prior[source]¶

Prior class template

The notation from the following book are used throughout the module:

Appendix A - Gelman, A., Stern, H.S., Carlin, J.B., Dunson, D.B., Vehtari, A. and Rubin, D.B., 2013. Bayesian data analysis. Chapman and Hall/CRC.

_random(n, hpd, f_rvs, f_ppf)[source]¶

Draw random samples from a given distribution

Parameters

  • n (int) – Number of samples

  • hpd (float) – Highest probability density to draw sample from

  • f_rvs (Callable) – Random variable function

  • f_ppf (Callable) – Inverse of cumulative distribution function

Returns

Random variable samples

Return type

rvs

random(n, hpd)[source]¶

Draw random samples from the prior distribution

Parameters

  • n (int) – Number of draws

  • hpd (float) – Highest Prior Density for drawing sample from (true for unimodal distribution)

Return type

ndarray

Return type

float

  • sigma (float) – Scale parameter > 0

find_hyperparameters(lb=0, ub=1, lb_prob=0.01, ub_prob=0.01)[source]¶

Find hyper-parameter values based on lower and upper bounds :type lb: Real :param lb: Lower bound :type ub: Real :param ub: Upper bound :type lb_prob: Real :param lb_prob: Probability at the lower bound :type ub_prob: Real :param ub_prob: Probability at the upper bound

Parameters

x – Quantiles

find_hyperparameters(lb, ub, lb_prob=0.01, ub_prob=0.01)[source]¶

Find hyperparameters

Parameters

  • lb – Lower value

  • ub – Upper value

  • lb_prob – Expected prior mass below lb

  • ub_prob – Expected prior mass above ub

Notes

If a solution is found, the values of the shape and scale hyperparameters are updated internally

References

Michael Betancourt, Robust Gaussian Processes in Stan, Part 3, https://betanalpha.github.io/assets/case_studies/gp_part3/part3.html
